ch.dieseite.colladaloader.asmbeans

Class ASUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dieseite.colladaloader.asmbeans.ASUtils

  • public class ASUtils
extends java.lang.Object

    This class contains utility tools for all common or proprietary assembling classes.

    This source is free; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License and by nameing of the originally author

    Version:
    3.1
    Author:
    Markus Zimmermann http://www.die-seite.ch

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public static SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> next(SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> record,
                                                                               int depth)
        jump (n = depth) times to next record (NOT into Children) It uses the "Record.info.next" field for it. If this is null then jumping is aborted with a null return
        Parameters:
        current - record
        depth -
        Returns:
        null if depth too high

      • childBySearch

        public static SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> childBySearch(SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> parent,
                                                                                        java.lang.String searchPtrn)
        returns the first match of the children from current Record that matches to search pattern. A pattern syntax can be a collada tag name or tag name plus attribute criteria
        Parameters:
        current - record
        searchPtrn - either "tagname" or "tagname#attribute=value"
        Returns:
        null if nothing found

      • execArgs

        public static SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> execArgs(java.lang.String args,
                                                                                   SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> r)

        runs childBySearch() back() and next() in args order. The syntax format for each argument is "[[j][b] depth][c tagname]" separated by one space char

        commands j = next, c = childBySearch, b = back

        an Example can be: "j 2 c instance_effect j 1"

        Parameters:
        args -
        current - record
        Returns:

      • back

        public static SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> back(SaxParser.Record<ObjectLinker.CTXInfo,ObjectLinker.RecInfo> record,
                                                                               int depth)
        jump (n = depth) times to previous record It uses the "Record.info.back" field for it. If this is null then jumping is aborted with a null returns
        Parameters:
        current - record
        depth -
        Returns:
        null if depth too high

      • loadTexture

        public static PImage loadTexture(java.lang.String texName,
                                 java.lang.String daeFile)
        loads a PImage from file using Processing API
        Parameters:
        image - file name, relative to collada file path (i.e untitled/texture0.jpg)
        collada - file path, relative to "data" path (i.e models/untitled.dae)
        Returns:
        a new image

      • to3DPoints

        public static ASUtils.Point3D[] to3DPoints(float[] floatarray)

        converts a collada <float_array> into 3D Points. Its also doing a coordinate convert from Collada to processing. Creates cloneable Points

        per definition is:

        processing x = Collada x

        processing y = Collada -z

        processing z = Collada -y

        Parameters:
        floatarray -
        Returns:
        a converted drawable 3DPoint Array

      • to2DPoints

        public static ASUtils.Point2D[] to2DPoints(float[] floatarray,
                                           float width,
                                           float height)

        converts a collada <float_array> into 2D Texture Points. Its also doing a coordinate convert from collada to processing.Creates cloneable Points

        per definition is:

        textureProcessing x = textureSketchup x * picture.width

        textureProcessing y = picture.height - textureSketchup y * picture.height

        Parameters:
        floatarray -
        imageWidth -
        imageHeight -
        Returns:
        a converted drawable 2DPoint Array

      • demuxPArray

        public static int[] demuxPArray(int[] pArray,
                                int offset,
                                int muxCnt)
        extract from a multiplexed <p> array the required indices for a Point2D or Point3D array
        Parameters:
        pArray - (=all indices values from <p> tag)
        offset - (= attribute value from collada <input> tag)
        muxCnt - (=how many float arrays is packed/multiplexed in <p> tag resp. in pArray)
        Returns:
        indices for access a raw Point[] array correctly

      • getParam

        public static <T> T getParam(java.util.ArrayList<DataAssembler.Param> p,
                             int index)
        returns and casts the nth param value from param list
        Parameters:
        p -
        index -
        Returns:
